abstract.t: In Situ Operations, Administration, and Maintenance (IOAM) is used for recording and collecting operational and telemetry information while the packet traverses a path between two points in the network. This document defines a type of IOAM Node Data that makes use of the Node Data Fields to help an opoerator gain visibility on environmental sustainability information on the Internet by providing per-hop (i.e., per topological network node) power metrics and other current or future sustainability metrics. This will contribute to achieving an objective mentioned in the IAB E-Impact workshop.

The techniques presented are useful not only in a transactional setting, but also in a scheduled automated setting where they may be run periodically in a mesh across an administrative domain to map out environmental-impact metrics.

section.title: Introduction
section.t: In situ Operations, Administration, and Maintenance (IOAM) collects operational and telemetry information in the packet while the packet traverses a path between two points in the network. The term "in situ" refers to the fact that the OAM data is added to the data packets rather than being sent within packets specifically dedicated to OAM. IOAM is used to complement mechanisms, such as Ping or Traceroute.

As the world transitions towards sustainability in technology, the focus is shifting not only on creating modern technologies infused with sustainability but also on bridging gaps in the tools that are already available, to enhance visibility, measurement, and quantification of their impact. Consequently, tools which have been foundational for control and management for decades now encounter new requirements including enhancing them to cater to a significantly increasing demand for monitoring the sustainability and environmental impact. This document serves that need by defining an IOAM Node Data that uses the Node Data Fields to gain visibility on environmental sustainability information
By using the combination of IOAM Data Fields, a device can explicitly add these exemplary environmental sustainability metrics for transmission across an administrative domain:

ul.li: Present and idle power (node level, component level)
